title: Skilled – Regional Sponsored visa (subclass 475)
summary: This page provides information about the Skilled – Regional Sponsored visa (subclass 475), which is now closed to new applications and subject to the 22 September 2015 Cap and Cease arrangement. It outlines visa validity, rights, obligations for visa holders and sponsors, and pathways to permanent residency.

cap_and_cease.description: Any visa application not decided before this date is taken not to have been made.

valid_from.applied_outside_australia: date of first entry into Australia

allowed_activities: remain in Australia for up to three years
live in a specified regional area in Australia
work or study in a specified regional area of Australia
become eligible to apply for permanent residency

requirements: lived in a specified regional area of Australia for two years
worked for at least 12 months in a specified regional area of Australia

must: live, study and work in regional Australia or a low population growth metropolitan area
comply with any residential conditions specified in nomination
if_nominated_by_state_or_territory.note: Proof of residence required when applying for subclass 887 permanent residency.

must: live, study and work in a designated area
prove time spent in that area when applying for permanent residence

change_notification_requirements.important_note: Failure to update passport details may cause delays at the airport or denial of boarding.

sponsor_information.applies_to: Sponsors of Skilled – Regional Sponsored visa (subclass 475) holders
sponsor_information.verification_tool: Visa Entitlement Verification Online (VEVO for Organisations)

sponsorship_validity.starts_from: date the visa holder first enters Australia

obligations: provide adequate accommodation and financial assistance
provide support such as child care to help relatives attend English classes
give information and advice to help relatives settle in Australia, including employment information
